forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 14 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph.

weather_report:
The air of Downtown San Francisco carries a hint of moisture this early morning, as a gentle veil of clouds stretches across the sky. The temperature hovers in that comfortable range, whispering promises of a pleasant day ahead. However, variable currents tease the edges of the fog that clings to the coastline, a familiar dance reminding us of the city's delicate romance with the marine layer. The fog may yet linger, albeit reluctantly, hinting at a haziness that could soften the sunlight later in the day.

As the sun ascends, it will gradually chase the clouds away, allowing the warmth of a mostly sunny afternoon to unfold. Highs will flirt just above the lower sixties, contrasting with cooler pockets in the shade and brisk breezes from the west. Layering becomes essential; a light jacket or sweater will serve well against the chill of morning and evening shadows, while comfortable attire will suffice for midday jaunts. Whether you choose to savor a stroll along the Embarcadero, explore the nooks of North Beach, or enjoy a quiet moment at your favorite café, the day invites exploration and the simple pleasures of urban life.
